what: World Health Organization TB data — bladder
title: World Health Organization TB data — bladder
text: Heart Failure: Controlled Trial Investigating Outcomes Exercise Training (HF-ACTION) study conducted 2003–2007 investigate whether adding exercise training usual care heart failure patients improves cardiovascular outcomes (O'Conner et al., 2009). dataset high-risk subgroup consisting 741 nonischemic patients baseline cardiopulmonary test duration less equal 12 minutes analyze recurrent hospitalizations well overall survival.

title: World Health Organization TB data — bladder
World Health Organization TB data — bladder
text: data frame 2,132 rows 4 variables: id Unique patient ID. time Event time (years). status Event type; 1 = hospitalization, 2 = death, 0 = censoring. trt 1 = exercise training, 0 = usual care.

title: World Health Organization TB data — bladder
text: O'CONNOR, C. M., WHELLAN, D. J., LEE, K. L., KETEYIAN, S. J.,  COOPER, L. S., ELLIS, S. J., LEIFER, E. S., KRAUS, W. E., KITZMAN, D. W., BLUMENTHAL, J. . et al. (2009). Efficacy safety exercise training  patients chronic heart failure: Hf-action randomized controlled trial.  J. . Med. Assoc. 301, 1439–1450.

what: rccf2: Cumulative Frequency of Recurrent Events in Presence of Death — rccf2-package
title: rccf2: Cumulative Frequency of Recurrent Events in Presence of Death — rccf2-package
text: Nonparametric estimation (two-sample) testing cumulative incidence function recurrent events presence death (Ghosh Lin, 2000, doi:10.1111/j.0006-341x.2000.00554.x ). Also implements joint test log-rank statistic death.

title: rccf2: Cumulative Frequency of Recurrent Events in Presence of Death — rccf2-package
